creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
inscription:
Written at edge: [64] (64th poem in the anthology); Sadayori's poem (and detailed description of the scene where the poem was made):

{Asa-borake 
Uji no kawa-giri
Taedae ni
Arawarewataru
Seze no ajiro-gi}

(Early dawn reveals fishing weirs in the morning mist of the Uji river)
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e), ink and color on paper
portfolio: One Hundred poems by One Hundred poets (Hyaku-nin isshu no uchi)
title: Illustration of the Fujiwara Sadayori's Poem
